intro: Phyllanthus petenensis, commonly known as the Petén spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its structure includes a short stem with opposite leaves and a unique inflorescence called a cyathium. Phyllanthus petenensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
